text:
Hello people, I am trying to install Sympy for symbolic integration and am confronted with
`Error: Could not parse entry for LinearAlgebra`
when going import Pkg; Pkg.add("SymPy").... Any thoughts? Thank you

elements.text: Hello people, I am trying to install Sympy for symbolic integration and am confronted with
Error: Could not parse entry for LinearAlgebra
when going import Pkg; Pkg.add("SymPy").... Any thoughts? Thank you

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>
Always include the stacktrace, it might not make sense to you but for anyone trying to help it is very useful.

text: Did you manually edit your manifest.toml?

elements.text: Did you manually edit your manifest.toml?

text: or perhaps it got corrupted somehow?

elements.text: or perhaps it got corrupted somehow?

text: Actually I changed the Manifest, but only of this project I am working on, locally...How could you tell?

elements.text: Actually I changed the Manifest, but only of this project I am working on, locally...How could you tell?

text: But the main Manifest of Julia, I did not alter this

elements.text: But the main Manifest of Julia, I did not alter this

text: because those kinds of errors are what you get when you manually edit a manifest

elements.text: because those kinds of errors are what you get when you manually edit a manifest

text: Is there a way to reset the main _Manifest.toml_ and _Project.toml_ of Julia inside _C:\Julia\Julia 1.5.2\bin_ ?
